intro: Raillardella eiseni, commonly known as the Eisen's raillardella, is a rare flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its small, yellowish flowers bloom in the spring, and the plant is known for its compact, low-growing habit. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Raillardella eiseni is considered a species of conservation concern.
